channel.title: Barely Functional - mgattozzi
channel.description: Thoughts and musings from a functional programmer who drinks too much coffee.

item.title: Schrodinger's Bug: Adventures in Asynchronous Debugging
item.description: Published March 20th, 2016 A look at dealing with errors in JS all due to not using promises correctly

item.title: Announcing Alchemist
item.description: Published May 5th, 2016 Alchemist was a small side project to make dealing with package name differences between distributions a lot easier. It would wrap around your platform's package manager seamlessly.

item.title: How do I convert a &str to a String in Rust?
item.description: Published May 24th, 2016 Okay so we have &str

item.title: How do I use the Standard Library Macros in Rust? Part 1
item.description: Published June 1st, 2016 There are a lot of stdlib macros. Just how do you use them and what are they used for?

item.title: One Year of Rust
item.description: Published August 8th, 2016 A look at my first year with Rust and a little over a year since 1.0 came out.

item.title: Understanding where clauses and trait constraints
item.description: Published September 13th, 2016 Traits constrain what generic types you can use, but they can also be powerful. Here we cover their uses and how they can be used.

item.title: Why you should be blogging about Rust
item.description: Published September 27th, 2016 Reasons to start a blog but with a Rust focus.

item.title: FFI with Haskell and Rust
item.description: Published October 1st, 2016 What if we put Rust code inside of Haskell? Here's how.

item.title: Using Haskell in Rust
item.description: Published October 15th, 2016 You can put Rust in Haskell, but can we do it the other way around? Yes. Yes we can.

item.title: Schemers - Input
item.description: Published November 9th, 2016 The first installation of my scheme interpreter course. Let's grab some input!

item.title: Schemers - Exercise 1
item.description: Published November 15th, 2016 The second installation of my scheme interpreter course. Let's go over the answers of exercise 1!

item.title: Russian Dolls and clean Rust code
item.description: Published November 28th, 2016 How to deal with nasty if let chains for Option or Result types using combinators!

item.title: Announcing Pipers - A small library for piping commands
item.description: Published December 23, 2016 A small announcement post for a library I built to pipe `Command`s called pipers.

item.title: Schemers - Parsers
item.description: Published December 16th, 2016 The third installation of my scheme interpreter course. Let's start building a parser!

item.title: Rust is its community
item.description: Published December 29th, 2016 One of many blog posts from Rust's Fireflower incident. Here I describe what Rust's strength truly is, it's community.

item.title: Diesel Powered Rocket
item.description: Published January 9, 2017 How to get Rocket, a Rust webframework working, while using Diesel for interacting with the database.

item.title: Building an Asynchronous Hyper Server
item.description: Published January 26th, 2017 How to use Hyper to asynchronously serve http requests from version 0.11's pre release

item.title: Using an Async Hyper Client
item.description: Published March 9th, 2017 How to use Hyper for http requests asynchronously from version 0.11's pre release

item.title: Lessons learned redesigning and refactoring a Rust Library
item.description: Published April 27, 2017 API design and more are covered here where I discuss bad design and how to fix it.

item.title: Two Years of Rust
item.description: Published May 14th, 2017 A two year retrospective on my usage of Rust.

item.title: Global Uninitialized Statics in Rust
item.description: Published May 30th, 2017 Rust very much does not like having global mutable variables. Here's how to do just that.

item.title: Avoiding Logic Bugs in Rust with Traits and Types
item.description: Published July 14th, 2017 Rust is really good at making sure the right types go in the right places. It can't stop programmers from implementing the logic correctly without some extra work. We cover how here!

item.title: Rust and the case for WebAssembly in 2018
item.description: Published December 5th, 2017 Pushing for Rust to focus it's resources in WebAssembly in 2018. This post kicked off the #Rust2018 call for blog posts to shape the 2018 roadmap.

item.title: 2017 Retrospective and 2018 Resolutions
item.description: Published January 1st, 2018 A look back at all I accomplished in 2017 and my plans for 2018.

item.title: On Coding with Depression
item.description: Published on January 12th, 2018 Suffering from mental illness is tough. Here I talk about some of my experiences working in the field while suffering from depression.

item.title: Words are Power: Writing Authoritative Documentation
item.description: Published February 8th, 2018 It's easy to write documentation with words that aren't clear cut. Here's some tips to avoid that
